note.p: Birth Place: Near Charing Cross, London, England
Education: Westminster School; Christ Church, Oxford; BA (1658), MA (1660)

Career: Began his travels before he had taken his Master's degree, captured by pirates and sold; returned to Oxford (c 1660); accompanied the Earl of Carlisle, Ambassador-Extraordinary to Sweden (1668); Secretary to the Embassy at Paris, where he acted as medium of communication between men of science in England and France (1669-1671); travelled through Venice, Dalmatia, Greece, Turkey and Persia, where he was murdered by some Arabs in a quarrel over a penknife
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; Foster
References: A Rupert Hall, 'John Collins on Newton's Telescope' in NR 1995 vol 49 pp 71-78
